subject: History
title: Medieval Guilds and Trade
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Medieval Guilds and Trade.

hook.text: Want to be a blacksmith in medieval London? You'd need seven years of unpaid training first.

buildup.text: Guilds controlled every tradeâ€”setting prices, quality standards, and who could work in each profession.

discovery.text: Apprentices became journeymen, then masters. Each guild kept trade secrets locked behind hierarchy.

twist.text: Guilds were also early welfare systems. They paid for members' funerals and supported widows and orphans.

climax.text: Guild halls became power centers. In some cities, guild leaders held more influence than nobles.

quiz.question: What social function did medieval guilds serve beyond regulating trade?
options: They served as courts for criminal trials
They provided welfare for members' families
They managed the local military defense
